title: Academic Research Dataset FAIRness Evaluator & Improvement Planner
description: Upload your dataset metadata, sample data files, documentation, and licensing info to receive a structured FAIRness evaluation report with prioritized improvement suggestions. Designed for academic research data managers to assess and enhance dataset compliance with FAIR principles in a streamlined, advisory manner.
inputLabel: Paste or upload your dataset metadata (e.g., Dublin Core XML, DataCite JSON-LD), sample data files (CSV, Excel, JSON), documentation text, and licensing description below. You may upload multiple files as needed.
outputLabel: FAIRness Evaluation Report and Improvement Plan
systemPrompt: You are a specialized assistant for academic research data managers evaluating the FAIRness compliance of research datasets. Given the provided dataset metadata, sample data files, documentation text, and licensing information, analyze these inputs to produce a clear, structured FAIRness evaluation report. The report must include scores or ratings for each of the FAIR principles (Findability, Accessibility, Interoperability, Reusability), a detailed checklist highlighting missing or insufficient FAIR components, and a prioritized, stepwise improvement plan with actionable recommendations to enhance dataset FAIRness. Your evaluation should be advisory, transparent, and avoid guaranteeing compliance. Refuse to process any inputs that appear to contain sensitive personal data or violate privacy. Output the report as plain text, optionally in JSON if requested, with clear sections and actionable guidance. Use only provided inputs and do not guess missing information. Enforce strict safety and privacy rules.

presets.label: Summary Report
presets.prompt: Provide a concise summary of the dataset's FAIRness evaluation, highlighting key scores and top improvement actions.

presets.label: Detailed Checklist
presets.prompt: Generate a detailed checklist of FAIR components present or missing in the dataset, organized by each FAIR principle.

presets.label: Improvement Plan
presets.prompt: Produce a prioritized, stepwise improvement plan with actionable recommendations to enhance dataset FAIRness.

presets.label: Full FAIRness Report
presets.prompt: Create a comprehensive FAIRness evaluation report including scores, checklist, improvement plan, and explanatory notes.

jsonSchemaHint: If structured-output is enabled, output a JSON object with keys: 'scores' (object with FAIR principle keys and numeric ratings), 'checklist' (array of items with 'principle', 'item', 'status', 'notes'), and 'improvementPlan' (array of steps with 'priority', 'action', 'details').
clarifyPrompt: To provide an accurate FAIRness evaluation, please confirm you have uploaded dataset metadata files, sample data files, documentation, and licensing information relevant to your dataset. Also specify any organizational or funder FAIR guidelines to consider.
finalizePrompt: Based on the inputs provided, generate the final FAIRness evaluation report with scores, checklist, and improvement plan. Ensure clarity, transparency, and actionable advice.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Research Dataset FAIRness Evaluator & Improvement Planner

niche.scenario: Evaluating and improving the FAIRness (Findability, Accessibility, Interoperability, Reusability) of research datasets prior to publication or sharing.

idea.problem: Academic research data managers often struggle to systematically assess and improve the FAIR principles compliance of their datasets, lacking an integrated tool that analyzes dataset metadata, formats, licensing, and documentation to produce clear FAIRness evaluation and actionable improvement plans.
inputs: Dataset metadata files (e.g., Dublin Core, DataCite XML, JSON-LD)
Sample data files or dataset snapshots (CSV, Excel, JSON, etc.)
Description of dataset licensing and access conditions
Existing documentation or README text files
Relevant organizational or funder FAIR guidelines
outputs: Structured FAIRness evaluation report with scores or ratings per FAIR principle
Detailed checklist highlighting missing or insufficient FAIR components
Prioritized, stepwise dataset improvement plan with recommended actions
Visual dashboard tracking FAIRness progress over time
whyItWins: Fills a gap by providing a specialized, integrated FAIRness assessment tool tailored to academic research data managers, unlike generic metadata validators or data management plan generators.
Automates a complex multi-dimensional evaluation of datasets, saving significant manual effort and reducing human error in FAIR compliance assessment.
Delivers actionable, prioritized improvement plans, not just diagnostic reports, facilitating practical dataset enhancement workflows.
Supports iterative dataset development with progress tracking, encouraging continuous FAIR improvements aligned with evolving standards.
Enables better compliance with funder and publisher data sharing requirements, enhancing research visibility and reuse.

upgradePath.today: A lightweight web app accepting dataset metadata and sample files to produce a simple FAIRness checklist and improvement suggestions in a single report.
upgradePath.in90Days: Add interactive dashboards, integration with common metadata standards and repositories, user accounts for dataset project tracking, and exportable improvement plan templates.
upgradePath.in12Months: Develop a full multi-page system with dataset version control, collaborative FAIR improvement workflows, automated metadata enrichment suggestions, integration with institutional repositories and funder portals, and FAIR compliance certification support.

riskNotes: Must carefully handle sensitive or unpublished data with strict privacy and security measures.
Evaluation algorithms should remain advisory and transparent to avoid overclaiming compliance or guaranteeing FAIRness.
Needs to stay updated with evolving FAIR principles and metadata standards to remain relevant and accurate.

blueprint.summary: A specialized web application for academic research data managers to evaluate, track, and improve the FAIRness of research datasets through automated assessments, actionable improvement plans, and progress dashboards.
successMetrics: Number of datasets assessed and tracked within the system
User engagement with improvement plans and dashboard features
Reduction in manual effort for FAIR compliance evaluation reported by users
Positive user feedback on clarity and usefulness of FAIRness reports
Adoption by institutions or research groups for dataset FAIRness management

notes: Handles retries and failure notifications on processing errors.

backgroundJobs.name: FAIRness Evaluation Processor
backgroundJobs.trigger: Triggered by API request to evaluate a dataset version
backgroundJobs.purpose: Runs evaluation algorithms asynchronously to generate FAIRness reports and improvement plans, updating data stores upon completion.

edgeCases: Handling incomplete or malformed metadata files without failing entire evaluation.
Managing large dataset sample files with timeouts or partial analysis fallback.
Ensuring data privacy and secure access for unpublished or sensitive datasets.
Dealing with evolving FAIR principles and metadata standards requiring re-evaluation or report updates.
Handling concurrent edits or uploads to the same dataset version with conflict resolution.
Gracefully recovering from background job failures and notifying users.
nonGoals: Providing full data repository hosting or long-term data storage beyond metadata and sample files references.
Guaranteeing official FAIR compliance certification or legal validation.
Replacing domain-specific metadata creation tools or general data management plan generators.
Supporting non-academic or non-research dataset types outside FAIR principles scope.

dataFlow: User accesses /login page and submits email and password to /api/auth/login.
On successful authentication, user receives token and userId, stored client-side for authenticated requests.
Authenticated user accesses /dashboard which calls /api/datasets (GET) to fetch owned datasets and /api/fairness-reports/:datasetId (GET) for reports to display scores and progress.
User navigates to /datasets to view dataset list fetched from /api/datasets (GET).
User creates a new dataset via /datasets page submitting form data to /api/datasets (POST), which validates and stores metadata and file references, returning datasetId.
User views or edits dataset details at /datasets/:id, fetching dataset info from /api/datasets/:id (GET).
User uploads metadata files, sample data files, documentation, or licensing info via /datasets/:id page, updating dataset via /api/datasets/:id (PATCH or POST if supported).
User triggers FAIRness evaluation on a dataset version by calling /api/datasets/:id/fairness-evaluate (POST) with version number, which enqueues background job.
Background job processes dataset asynchronously, generating FAIRnessReport and ImprovementPlan, storing results in data stores.
User views FAIRness reports via /api/fairness-reports/:datasetId (GET) and improvement plans via /api/improvement-plans/:reportId (GET).
User updates improvement plan actions and completion status via /api/improvement-plans/:planId (POST).
Dashboard UI reflects updated FAIRness scores and improvement progress based on latest data.
validationRules: Login API: Validate email format and password presence; reject invalid credentials with generic error.
Dataset creation: Title required, non-empty string; metadataFiles, sampleDataFiles, documentationFiles must be valid JSON if provided; licensingInfo optional string.
Dataset updates: Validate file references and metadata schema compliance against supported metadata standards.
FAIRness evaluation trigger: version number must be positive integer and correspond to existing dataset version.
Improvement plan updates: actions and completionStatus must be valid JSON structures; notes optional string with max length limit.
All authenticated API routes require valid token and user ownership verification for dataset or report access.
File uploads must be scanned for allowed types and size limits; metadata files must conform to supported standards schemas.
Concurrent edits to dataset metadata or improvement plans must be detected and rejected or merged with conflict resolution.
errorHandling: Authentication failures return 401 Unauthorized with generic message to avoid information leakage.
Validation errors return 400 Bad Request with field-specific error messages.
Access denied due to ownership or role returns 403 Forbidden.
Not found resources return 404 Not Found.
Background job failures log errors, retry up to configured attempts, and notify users via dashboard notifications or email.
Large file uploads exceeding limits return 413 Payload Too Large.
Malformed metadata files during evaluation are logged and skipped with partial evaluation results returned.
API responses include consistent error object with code, message, and optional details.
Client UI displays error messages in context with retry options where applicable.
securityNotes: Use HTTPS for all client-server communication to protect credentials and tokens.
Store hashed passwords securely using strong hashing algorithms (e.g., bcrypt).
Implement role-based access control to restrict dataset and report access to owners and authorized roles.
Sanitize and validate all inputs to prevent injection attacks.
Use secure cookies or authorization headers for session tokens with appropriate expiration and refresh mechanisms.
Ensure file uploads are scanned and stored securely with access restrictions.
Audit logs for user actions on datasets and FAIRness evaluations for compliance and troubleshooting.
Protect background job processing endpoints and queues from unauthorized access.
Regularly update FAIR guidelines integration to avoid outdated or insecure dependencies.

They receive a list of datasets they own with correct metadata

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user views a dataset detail page

acceptanceTests.then: The plan is updated and success response is returned

acceptanceTests.given: User attempts to access dataset they do not own
acceptanceTests.when: They request dataset details or update

acceptanceTests.then: Evaluation completes with partial results and logs warnings without failing entirely
